Comment: Trump was raised by his father to see the world as being comprised of winners and losers, and to never be a loser.  Trump has also been a Russophile for decades and thinks of Putin as his friend.  So he is heavily invested emotionally in favoring Russia, as he sees Putin as a great success and wishes to be like him.  There are only two things that are going to change Trump's mind about Ukraine and Putin:  \- He comes to believe that Putin is a loser  \- He starts to think that Putin is not his friend  There is a slight chance that Trump had a sort of epiphany by having his ego bruised.  Zelensky was applauded at the Pope's funeral, while he was not, which makes him feel inadequate.  Meanwhile, Russian state media is openly mocking Trump for being a dupe.  Trump has a track record of dumping his friends.  That's especially true if he comes to see them as losers.
